item.title: Report E-2024040121
item.description:
Report E-2024040121

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: LAKE POINT
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1729 Eastern time on 03/20/2024 Driver was doing a load check at the fuel stop, noticed liquid dripping put of trailer. Driver then contacted our emergency response and crew were dispatched to perform clean up. Crew arrived at approximately 1900 eastern time and located a small pinhole in the bottom of a 55 gallon drum. Crew started clean up and it was determined that around 1 gallon of liquid was discharged and was cleaned up with absorbent and repacked for transport. Clean up was complete at approximately 2000 Eastern time.

item.title: Report E-2024040061
item.description:
Report E-2024040061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 27, 2024, three (3) bags of calcium peroxide were punctured by a nail in transit and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a HEPA shop vacuum to collect the free product from the trailer floor. ER personnel then utilized degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All calcium peroxide impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and three (3) damaged bags of product were collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for disposal.
